alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 8:05AM EST until January 03 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. .The river has fallen to flood stage and will continue fall at Heidelberg through midweek. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...From this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EST Monday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.0 feet Friday evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EST.
